chunks.text: ### Requirements for entry clearance and settlement for a Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
chunks.summary: This provision applies to Gurkha and Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997 seeking entry clearance or settlement. They must demonstrate appropriate service and meet specific eligibility criteria. No exceptions are specified beyond the discharge date threshold.

metadata.section_id: Validity requirements for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

AF (GHK) 1.1. A person applying from outside the UK must apply online for entry clearance on the gov.uk website on the specified form VAF AF, or in person at the Visa Application Centre in Kathmandu.

AF (GHK) 1.2. A person applying in the UK must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form SET(AF).

1.   AF (GHK) 1.3. An application must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality.

AF (GHK) 1.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to Gurkha and Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997 seeking entry clearance. Applicants must submit online or in person, pay fees, provide biometrics, and submit identity documents; failure to meet these criteria may result in rejection.

### Validity requirements for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

AF (GHK) 1.1. A person applying from outside the UK must apply online for entry clearance on the gov.uk website on the specified form VAF AF, or in person at the Visa Application Centre in Kathmandu.

AF (GHK) 1.2. A person applying in the UK must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form SET(AF).

1.   AF (GHK) 1.3. An application must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality.

AF (GHK) 1.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

AF (GHK) 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

AF (GHK) 2.2. If the applicant is in the UK on the date of application, they must not be in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded.
chunks.summary: This section applies to Gurkha or Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997 applying for immigration. They must meet suitability criteria, with no grounds for refusal under Part Suitability, and if in the UK, they must not breach immigration laws unless covered by specific exceptions for overstaying.

### Suitability requirements for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

AF (GHK) 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

AF (GHK) 2.2. If the applicant is in the UK on the date of application, they must not be in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded.

chunks.text: ### Eligibility requirements for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
chunks.summary: This provision applies to Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veterans discharged before 1 July 1997. They must meet specific eligibility criteria to qualify, with conditions such as prior service and discharge date being critical; exceptions are not specified in this segment.
chunks.augmented_text:

Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veterans discharged before 1 July 1997. They must meet specific eligibility criteria to qualify, with conditions such as prior service and discharge date being critical; exceptions are not specified in this segment.

### Eligibility requirements for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements

AF (GHK) 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military veteran before they arrive in the UK.

AF (GHK) 3.2. A person applying must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Gurkha and Hong Kong military veterans seeking entry to the UK must obtain entry clearance before arrival. Applicants must also provide a tuberculosis screening certificate if applicable, with specific medical verification required.
chunks.augmented_text:

Section: Entry requirements
Topic: leave-to-enter

Summary: Gurkha and Hong Kong military veterans seeking entry to the UK must obtain entry clearance before arrival. Applicants must also provide a tuberculosis screening certificate if applicable, with specific medical verification required.

### Entry requirements

AF (GHK) 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military veteran before they arrive in the UK.

AF (GHK) 3.2. A person applying must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

chunks.text:
### Military Service Eligibility requirements

1.   AF (GHK) 4.1. The applicant must be one of the following: 
    1.   (a) a national or citizen of Nepal who served in the Brigade of Gurkhas of the British Army and was discharged before 1 July 1997; or
    2.   (b) a national or citizen of China, enlisted in Hong Kong (Hong Kong Chinese locally enlisted personnel) who served in the Hong Kong Military Service Corps (HKMSC) of the British Army and was discharged before 1 July 1997; or
    3.   (c) a national or citizen of China, enlisted in Hong Kong (Hong Kong Chinese locally enlisted personnel) who served in the Hong Kong Squadron of the Royal Navy and was discharged before 1 July 1997.

1.   AF (GHK) 4.2. The applicant’s established military service must have been for a continuous period of at least 4 years, unless one or more of the following applies: 
    1.   (a) the applicant is in receipt of a Ministry of Defence (MoD) disability pension; or
    2.   (b) the applicant has a medal awarded by the MoD for gallantry.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to former Gurkha and Hong Kong Chinese military personnel discharged before 1 July 1997. Applicants must have served a minimum of 4 years, unless they receive a disability pension or a gallantry medal; service must have been continuous.
chunks.augmented_text:

Summary: This provision applies to former Gurkha and Hong Kong Chinese military personnel discharged before 1 July 1997. Applicants must have served a minimum of 4 years, unless they receive a disability pension or a gallantry medal; service must have been continuous.

### Military Service Eligibility requirements

1.   AF (GHK) 4.1. The applicant must be one of the following: 
    1.   (a) a national or citizen of Nepal who served in the Brigade of Gurkhas of the British Army and was discharged before 1 July 1997; or
    2.   (b) a national or citizen of China, enlisted in Hong Kong (Hong Kong Chinese locally enlisted personnel) who served in the Hong Kong Military Service Corps (HKMSC) of the British Army and was discharged before 1 July 1997; or
    3.   (c) a national or citizen of China, enlisted in Hong Kong (Hong Kong Chinese locally enlisted personnel) who served in the Hong Kong Squadron of the Royal Navy and was discharged before 1 July 1997.

1.   AF (GHK) 4.2. The applicant’s established military service must have been for a continuous period of at least 4 years, unless one or more of the following applies: 
    1.   (a) the applicant is in receipt of a Ministry of Defence (MoD) disability pension; or
    2.   (b) the applicant has a medal awarded by the MoD for gallantry.

metadata.section_id: Decision on an application as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997.
metadata.section_title: Decision on an application as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997.

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997.

AF (GHK) 5.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for entry clearance or settlement for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran are met, the application will be granted; otherwise, the application will be refused.

AF (GHK) 5.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to Gurkha and Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997, determining their eligibility for entry clearance or settlement. If all suitability and eligibility criteria are met, the application is granted; otherwise, it is refused, but an Administrative Review can be requested upon refusal.

### Decision on an application as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997.

AF (GHK) 5.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for entry clearance or settlement for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran are met, the application will be granted; otherwise, the application will be refused.

AF (GHK) 5.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

chunks.text:
### Period and conditions of grant for a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997

AF (GHK) 6.1. Where the applicant is outside the UK, they will be granted entry clearance for settlement.

AF (GHK) 6.2. Where the applicant is in the UK, they will be granted settlement.
chunks.summary: Gurkha and Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997 are eligible for settlement; those outside the UK receive entry clearance, while those inside are granted settlement, with no specified exceptions.

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

AF (GHK) 7.1. A person applying from outside the UK must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form VAF AF, or in person at the Visa Application Centre in Kathmandu.

AF (GHK) 7.2. A person applying in the UK, must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form SET(AF).

1.   AF (GHK) 7.3. An application as a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee must have been paid (unless the applicant has been granted a fee waiver); and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other document that satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality.

AF (GHK) 7.4. An applicant applying as a partner must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

AF (GHK) 7.5. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners, bereaved partners, or children of Gurkha or Hong Kong military veterans. Applicants must apply online or in person, pay applicable fees or obtain a waiver, provide biometric data, and demonstrate identity and nationality; partners must be at least 18. Non-compliance with these requirements may result in application rejection.

1.   AF (GHK) 7.3. An application as a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran must meet all the following requirements:

AF (GHK) 7.4. An applicant applying as a partner must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

AF (GHK) 7.5. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

AF (GHK) 8.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

AF (GHK) 8.2. If the applicant is in the UK on the date of application, they must not in breach of immigration laws, except that, where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, any current period of overstaying will be disregarded.

metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

chunks.text:
### Eligibility requirements for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

1.   AF (GHK) 9.1. The applicant must be the partner or child of a person where the person: 
    1.   (a) has entry clearance or settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under the pre-1997 Gurkha scheme (Gurkhas discharged before 1 July 1997 and their family members concession published on GOV.UK from 2008 to 2023), or Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997; or
    2.   (b) is, at the same time, applying for (and is granted) entry clearance or settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997; or
    3.   (c) is a deceased Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners or children of Gurkha and Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997. Applicants must be related to a veteran with valid entry clearance, settlement, or who is deceased, and the veteran must meet specific prior eligibility criteria under the pre-1997 Gurkha scheme.

Applicants must be related to a veteran with valid entry clearance, settlement, or who is deceased, and the veteran must meet specific prior eligibility criteria under the pre-1997 Gurkha scheme.

### Eligibility requirements for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

1.   AF (GHK) 9.1. The applicant must be the partner or child of a person where the person: 
    1.   (a) has entry clearance or settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under the pre-1997 Gurkha scheme (Gurkhas discharged before 1 July 1997 and their family members concession published on GOV.UK from 2008 to 2023), or Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997; or
    2.   (b) is, at the same time, applying for (and is granted) entry clearance or settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997; or
    3.   (c) is a deceased Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.section_id: Entry requirement for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or member of a Hong Kong military unit veteran
metadata.section_title: Entry requirement for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or member of a Hong Kong military unit veteran

chunks.text:
### Entry requirement for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or member of a Hong Kong military unit veteran

AF (GHK) 10.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as the partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran must have obtained entry clearance before they arrive in the UK.

AF (GHK) 10.2. A person seeking to come to the UK as the partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Partners, bereaved partners, or children of Gurkha or Hong Kong military veterans must obtain entry clearance before arrival and, if applicable, provide a valid TB screening certificate confirming they do not have active pulmonary tuberculosis.
chunks.augmented_text:

Section: Entry requirement for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or member of a Hong Kong military unit veteran
Topic: leave-to-enter

Summary: Partners, bereaved partners, or children of Gurkha or Hong Kong military veterans must obtain entry clearance before arrival and, if applicable, provide a valid TB screening certificate confirming they do not have active pulmonary tuberculosis.

### Entry requirement for a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or member of a Hong Kong military unit veteran

AF (GHK) 10.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as the partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran must have obtained entry clearance before they arrive in the UK.

AF (GHK) 10.2. A person seeking to come to the UK as the partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.section_id: Relationship requirements of a partner, bereaved partner of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran
metadata.section_title: Relationship requirements of a partner, bereaved partner of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirements of a partner, bereaved partner of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

AF (GHK) 11.1. If applying as a partner, other than a bereaved partner, the requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

AF (GHK) 11.2. If the applicant is applying as a bereaved partner, they must provide a death certificate for the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.

1.   AF (GHK) 11.3. If the applicant is applying as a bereaved partner, the following requirements must be met: 
    1.   (a) if the applicant is applying as a bereaved partner of a Hong Kong military unit veteran, and they or their partner was in a polygamous marriage or civil partnership at the time of the veteran’s death, they may only rely on that marriage or civil partnership for the purposes of an application for entry clearance or settlement as a partner where no other partner to the marriage or civil partnership is seeking, or has been granted entry clearance or settlement;
    2.   (b) a bereaved partner of a Gurkha must be: 
        1.   (i) the first or only partner on the Kindred Roll; or
        2.   (ii) the next in turn according to the order in which they were registered on the Kindred Roll, if the applicant can show that the first partner has permanently waived their right to come to the UK; and

    3.   (c) the applicant must show that their deceased partner either: 
        1.   (i) had, before their death, been granted entry clearance or settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under the pre-1997 Gurkha concession or under Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997; or
        2.   (ii) would have met the requirements for entry clearance or settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997, had they not died; and

    4.   (d) the applicant must not have remarried; and
    5.   (e) the relationship between the applicant and their partner must have been genuine and subsisting at the date of the Gurkha’s or Hong Kong military unit veteran’s death.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying as a partner or bereaved partner of a Gurkha or Hong Kong veteran must meet specific relationship criteria, including providing a death certificate for bereaved partners. Bereaved partners of Gurkha veterans must be the first or only partner on the Kindred Roll or second with proof the first waived their rights, with polygamous marriages only accepted under strict conditions.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
Section ID: Relationship requirements of a partner, bereaved partner of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran
Section: Relationship requirements of a partner, bereaved partner of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran
Topic: family

Summary: Applicants applying as a partner or bereaved partner of a Gurkha or Hong Kong veteran must meet specific relationship criteria, including providing a death certificate for bereaved partners. Bereaved partners of Gurkha veterans must be the first or only partner on the Kindred Roll or second with proof the first waived their rights, with polygamous marriages only accepted under strict conditions.

### Relationship requirements of a partner, bereaved partner of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

AF (GHK) 11.1. If applying as a partner, other than a bereaved partner, the requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

AF (GHK) 11.2. If the applicant is applying as a bereaved partner, they must provide a death certificate for the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.

1.   AF (GHK) 11.3. If the applicant is applying as a bereaved partner, the following requirements must be met: 
    1.   (a) if the applicant is applying as a bereaved partner of a Hong Kong military unit veteran, and they or their partner was in a polygamous marriage or civil partnership at the time of the veteran’s death, they may only rely on that marriage or civil partnership for the purposes of an application for entry clearance or settlement as a partner where no other partner to the marriage or civil partnership is seeking, or has been granted entry clearance or settlement;
    2.   (b) a bereaved partner of a Gurkha must be: 
        1.   (i) the first or only partner on the Kindred Roll; or
        2.   (ii) the next in turn according to the order in which they were registered on the Kindred Roll, if the applicant can show that the first partner has permanently waived their right to come to the UK; and

    3.   (c) the applicant must show that their deceased partner either: 
        1.   (i) had, before their death, been granted entry clearance or settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under the pre-1997 Gurkha concession or under Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997; or
        2.   (ii) would have met the requirements for entry clearance or settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997, had they not died; and

    4.   (d) the applicant must not have remarried; and
    5.   (e) the relationship between the applicant and their partner must have been genuine and subsisting at the date of the Gurkha’s or Hong Kong military unit veteran’s death.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

metadata.section_id: Relationship requirements for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.section_title: Relationship requirements for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirements for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

AF (GHK) 12.1. The applicant must be the child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran who has been or is being granted settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.

1.   AF (GHK) 12.2. If the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran is deceased at the date of application (“bereaved child”), the applicant must show that their parent either: 
    1.   a) before their death had been granted entry clearance or settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under the pre-1997 Gurkha scheme (Gurkhas discharged before 1 July 1997 and their family members concession published on GOV.UK from 2008 to 2023) or under Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997; or
    2.   b) would have met the requirements for settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997 had they not died.

AF (GHK) 12.3. If the applicant is applying as a bereaved child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997, they must provide a death certificate for the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to children of Gurkha or Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997 seeking settlement. Applicants must demonstrate their parent’s veteran status, and bereaved children must provide proof of the veteran’s death and eligibility at the time of discharge or settlement. Critical conditions include proving prior settlement eligibility or that the parent would have qualified under existing schemes.

Topic: settlement

Summary: This provision applies to children of Gurkha or Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997 seeking settlement. Applicants must demonstrate their parent’s veteran status, and bereaved children must provide proof of the veteran’s death and eligibility at the time of discharge or settlement. Critical conditions include proving prior settlement eligibility or that the parent would have qualified under existing schemes.

### Relationship requirements for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

AF (GHK) 12.1. The applicant must be the child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran who has been or is being granted settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.

1.   AF (GHK) 12.2. If the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran is deceased at the date of application (“bereaved child”), the applicant must show that their parent either: 
    1.   a) before their death had been granted entry clearance or settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under the pre-1997 Gurkha scheme (Gurkhas discharged before 1 July 1997 and their family members concession published on GOV.UK from 2008 to 2023) or under Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997; or
    2.   b) would have met the requirements for settlement as a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran under Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997 had they not died.

AF (GHK) 12.3. If the applicant is applying as a bereaved child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged from service before 1 July 1997, they must provide a death certificate for the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.section_title: Child requirements for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

chunks.text:
### Child requirements for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

1.   AF (GHK) 13.1. If the applicant is aged under 18 on the date of application, the applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) care requirement; and
    2.   (b) age and independent life requirement.

1.   AF (GHK) 13.2. If the applicant is aged 18 or over on the date of application, they must meet all of the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) they must have been aged under 18 on the date the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran parent was discharged; and
    2.   (b) they must be living in the same household as the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran parent; and
    3.   (c) they must not have been living in a different household from the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran parent for more than 2 years continuously before the date of application; and
    4.   (d) they must never have lived in a different household from the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran parent for more than 2 years continuously, unless this was by reason of education or something similar (such that the family unit was maintained during the period when the applicant did not live in the same household); and
    5.   (e) have not formed an independent family unit.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to children of Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veterans discharged before 1 July 1997. It requires applicants under 18 to meet care and independence criteria and those 18 or over to have lived with the veteran and not formed an independent family unit, with specific household continuity conditions. Exceptions relate to education or maintaining the family unit during temporary separations.

Exceptions relate to education or maintaining the family unit during temporary separations.

### Child requirements for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997

1.   AF (GHK) 13.1. If the applicant is aged under 18 on the date of application, the applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) care requirement; and
    2.   (b) age and independent life requirement.

1.   AF (GHK) 13.2. If the applicant is aged 18 or over on the date of application, they must meet all of the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) they must have been aged under 18 on the date the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran parent was discharged; and
    2.   (b) they must be living in the same household as the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran parent; and
    3.   (c) they must not have been living in a different household from the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran parent for more than 2 years continuously before the date of application; and
    4.   (d) they must never have lived in a different household from the Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran parent for more than 2 years continuously, unless this was by reason of education or something similar (such that the family unit was maintained during the period when the applicant did not live in the same household); and
    5.   (e) have not formed an independent family unit.

metadata.section_id: Eligibility requirement for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997 relying on Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights
metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirement for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997 relying on Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights

chunks.text:
### Eligibility requirement for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997 relying on Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights

AF (GHK) 13A.1. Where the applicant does not meet the eligibility requirements of AF (GHK) 13.2. but the decision maker is satisfied that refusal of the application would breach Article 8 of the Human Rights Convention because it would result in unjustifiably harsh consequences for the applicant or their family, the applicant will meet the Article 8 ECHR eligibility requirement.

AF (GHK) 13A.2. Where AF (GHK) 13A.1. applies, and the applicant falls for refusal under SUI 2.1., SUI 2.3., SUI 4.1., or SUI 5.1., of Part Suitability, the application as a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997, must be refused.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to children of Gurkha or Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997 seeking UK immigration under ECHR Article 8. It allows discretionary approval if refusal would cause unjustifiably harsh consequences for the family, but applications must be refused if the applicant fails suitability criteria. Critical thresholds include meeting Article 8 criteria and satisfying suitability conditions.

It allows discretionary approval if refusal would cause unjustifiably harsh consequences for the family, but applications must be refused if the applicant fails suitability criteria. Critical thresholds include meeting Article 8 criteria and satisfying suitability conditions.

### Eligibility requirement for a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997 relying on Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights

AF (GHK) 13A.1. Where the applicant does not meet the eligibility requirements of AF (GHK) 13.2. but the decision maker is satisfied that refusal of the application would breach Article 8 of the Human Rights Convention because it would result in unjustifiably harsh consequences for the applicant or their family, the applicant will meet the Article 8 ECHR eligibility requirement.

AF (GHK) 13A.2. Where AF (GHK) 13A.1. applies, and the applicant falls for refusal under SUI 2.1., SUI 2.3., SUI 4.1., or SUI 5.1., of Part Suitability, the application as a child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997, must be refused.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Gurkha and Hong Kong military unit veteran discharged before 1 July 1997
metadata.section_id: Decision on an application as a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.
metadata.section_title: Decision on an application as a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.

AF (GHK) 14.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for either a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran are met, the application will be granted; otherwise, the application will be refused.

AF (GHK) 14.2. If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review, except where the applicant is an Adult Dependent Relative.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners, bereaved partners, or children of Gurkha and Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997. The decision maker grants or refuses applications based on meeting suitability and eligibility criteria, with refusals subject to Administrative Review unless the applicant is an Adult Dependent Relative.

The decision maker grants or refuses applications based on meeting suitability and eligibility criteria, with refusals subject to Administrative Review unless the applicant is an Adult Dependent Relative.

### Decision on an application as a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran.

AF (GHK) 14.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for either a partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran are met, the application will be granted; otherwise, the application will be refused.

AF (GHK) 14.2. If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review, except where the applicant is an Adult Dependent Relative.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

AF (GHK) 15.1. Where the applicant is outside the UK, they will be granted entry clearance for settlement.

AF (GHK) 15.2. Where the application is in the UK, they will be granted settlement.

Print this page
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners, bereaved partners, or children of Gurkha or Hong Kong military veterans discharged before 1 July 1997. They are eligible for settlement, either through entry clearance if outside the UK or indefinite leave if within the UK, with no specified thresholds or exceptions noted.

### Period of grant for partner, bereaved partner or child of a Gurkha or Hong Kong military unit veteran

AF (GHK) 15.1. Where the applicant is outside the UK, they will be granted entry clearance for settlement.

AF (GHK) 15.2. Where the application is in the UK, they will be granted settlement.
